alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 04 at 2:56AM PST until March 06 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, except up to 2 feet above 7000 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph, with up to 100 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds may cause tree damage and lead to some power outages. Blowing and drifting snow may bring near zero visibility at times and rapid disorientation if attempting to travel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional snow loading on top of very deep existing snowpack may create unusual hazards including, but not limited to: structural instabilities, roofalanches, fire hydrant access problems, delayed first responders, and shelter in place orders. There are two periods to watch for heavier rates of snowfall, where rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible: late this afternoon and evening, and again Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
